original: Nibbānaṁ tāṇaṁ leṇaṁ saraṇaṁ parāyanaṁ accutaṁ amatanti?
analyzed: nibbānam tāṇam leṇam saraṇam parāyanam accutam
translated: “Is Nibbāna a refuge, a shelter, a resort, a recourse, a support, the incomparable field of merit, the deathless, the undying?”
“Is space unformed, and is Nibbāna unformed?”
“Are there two refuges … two resorts … two supports … two incomparable fields of merit … two deathless elements … two undying elements?”

analyzed: atthi keci an ākāsam ākāsam karonti iti
translated: “Are there any who make space non-space?”

analyzed: atthi keci saṅkhatam a saṅkhatam karonti iti
translated: “Are there any who make the formed unformed?”

analyzed: atthi keci ākāsam an ākāsam karonti iti
translated: “Are there any who make space non-space?”

analyzed: atthi keci asaṅkhatam saṅkhatam karonti iti
translated: “Are there any who make the unformed formed?”

“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye faculty and the eye consciousness?” …

original: Ākāsaṁ parivāretvā gharāni karonti koṭṭhāni karontīti?
analyzed: ākāsam parivāretvā gharāni karonti koṭṭhāni karonti iti
translated: “Do they build houses and huts that surround space?”

original: Asaṅkhataṁ parivāretvā gharāni karonti koṭṭhāni karontīti?
analyzed: asaṅkhatam parivāretvā gharāni karonti koṭṭhāni karonti iti
translated: “Do they build houses and huts that surround the unformed element?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye sense-sphere and in the eye-consciousness element?” …

“Is the formed element the unformed element?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

original: Tucchaudapāne pūriyamāne, tucchakoṭṭhe pūriyamāne, tucchakumbhiyā pūriyamānāya ākāso antaradhāyatīti?

translated: “When an empty well is being filled up, when an empty barn is being filled up, when an empty tub is being filled up, does space disappear?”
